citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
***The facility has not been able to obtain services from a local veterinarian that is able to regularly visit the premises and
sign on to a written program of veterinary care.
The licensee shall employ an attending veterinarian under formal arrangements. In the case of a part-time attending
veterinarian or consultant arrangements, the formal arrangements shall include a written program of veterinary care and
regularly scheduled visits to the premises of the dealer.
Correct by January 8, 2024.

***There are no records of animals on hand available for review. The licensee stated the records have not been updated.
Licensee shall make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose the following information
concerning animals purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, leased, or otherwise in his or her possession or under
his or her control, or which is transported, sold, euthanized, or otherwise disposed of by that dealer. The records shall
include any offspring born of any animal while in his or her possession or under his or her control. Records shall be made
available for review by USDA Officials upon request.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.40(a)(1) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
***The facility has not been able to obtain services from a local veterinarian that is able to regularly visit the premises and 
sign on to a written program of veterinary care. 
 
The licensee shall employ an attending veterinarian under formal arrangements. In the case of a part-time attending 
veterinarian or consultant arrangements, the formal arrangements shall include a written program of veterinary care and 
regularly scheduled visits to the premises of the dealer. 
 
Correct by January 8, 2024. 
2.75(b)  Repeat
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
***There are no records of animals on hand available for review. The licensee stated the records have not been updated.  
 
Licensee shall make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose the following information 
concerning animals purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, leased, or otherwise in his or her possession or under 
his or her control, or which is transported, sold, euthanized, or otherwise disposed of by that dealer. The records shall 
include any offspring born of any animal while in his or her possession or under his or her control. Records shall be made 
available for review by USDA Officials upon request. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
 n
